Defining the Default Revision

The default revision is typically the latest revision of a versioned file; however, it can be a version label. Default revisions can be defined in a configuration file or workspace setting.

To define a default revision in a workspace setting:

  1. Select File | Set Workspace to set the workspace you want to edit.
  2. Select File | Properties and then select the Workspace Settings tab.
  3. In the Default Version field, enter the version label you want to use as the default revision or click the Browse button to select one.
